intro: Dicoma dinteri, commonly known as the Dinter's dicoma, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptations to arid environments. The plant features a short, thick stem with numerous cylindrical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the summer months. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
